instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - no green light
threads.message:
have a 820-00165 that had liquid damage on u7090 area,

I replaced everything visually damaged,

L7095
C7094
C7095
U7090
R7080
C7092

checked for continuity and it seems fine,

PPBUS_G3H is present,
PP3V42_G3H is present,

but still no green light, please help! thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - no green light
threads.message: Using known good MagSafe board and flat cable? Exact voltage on PPBUS? Inspected J9500?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - no green light
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H - 8.18V

J9500 No damage there at all, 

and the Magsafe and Flat cable are known good, also tested from other macs to make sure, and no luck

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - no green light
threads.message: 8.18 volts on PPBUS means the SMC is not running. Voltage on SMC_RESET_L? If 3.4, either the ISL or SMC is likely bad.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - no green light
threads.message:
SMC was the problem, but I just reflowed it and it worked, did not reball, 

thank you for all the help, mark as solved!
